alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; East Glacier Park Region; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains; Gates of the Mountains; Northern High Plains; Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 18 at 8:44PM MDT until April 19 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations two to four inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and southwest Montana. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
